    • Method Detail

      • getLabeledComponents

        public ConnectedComponent getLabeledComponents(LabelingPolicy labelingPolicy,
                                               int foregroundColor,
                                               boolean removeBorderComponent,
                                               double thresholdComponentVolume,
                                               boolean setRandomColors)
                                        throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Description copied from interface: ImageConnectedComponents
        Constructs a ConnectedComponent derived class instance with relevant dimension (2D or 3D) and labels the components. The input image must have type Gray8. Filters the image components according to two criteria:
        • Possibly remove the components which are on the edge of the image
        • Possibly remove the components with size bellow some threshold
        Specified by:
        getLabeledComponents in interface ImageConnectedComponents
        Parameters:
        labelingPolicy - Can be 3D components labeling, or slice by slice against a given axis.
        foregroundColor - label of the 1's in the input image inputImage
        removeBorderComponent - true if the components which are on the edge of the image should be removed by filtering
        thresholdComponentVolume - minimal volume for filtering (taking into account the calibration) for the components. 0 if no minimal volume is required
        setRandomColors - true if the colors of the original image should be set according to the components labels.
        Returns:
        an instance of a concrete derived class for ConnectedComponent
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - in case the number of connected components exceeds the Short.MAX_VALUE (32767) or if the image doesn't have type GRAY8.
        See Also:
        ImageConnectedComponents.getLabeledComponents(wrapScienceJ.wrapImaJ.connectivity.LabelingPolicy, int, boolean, double, boolean)

      • getLabeledComponents

        public ConnectedComponent getLabeledComponents(LabelingPolicy labelingPolicy,
                                               int foregroundColor,
                                               boolean removeBorderComponent,
                                               double thresholdComponentVolume,
                                               ComponentRemovalPredicate removalPredicate,
                                               boolean keepPredicate,
                                               boolean setRandomColors)
                                        throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Description copied from interface: ImageConnectedComponents
        Constructs a ConnectedComponent derived class instance with relevant dimension (2D or 3D) and labels the components. The input image must have type Gray8. Filters the image components according to two criteria:
        • Possibly remove the components which are on the edge of the image
        • Possibly remove the components with size bellow some threshold
        Specified by:
        getLabeledComponents in interface ImageConnectedComponents
        Parameters:
        labelingPolicy - Can be 3D components labeling, or slice by slice against a given axis.
        foregroundColor - label of the 1's in the input image inputImage
        removeBorderComponent - true if the components which are on the edge of the image should be removed by filtering
        thresholdComponentVolume - minimal volume for filtering (taking into account the calibration) for the components. 0 if no minimal volume is required
        removalPredicate - a predicate according to which components should be filtered out
        keepPredicate - true if we should keep the components with a voxel satisfying removalPredicate, and false if we should remove the components with a voxel satisfying removalPredicate
        setRandomColors - true if the colors of the original image should be set according to the components labels.
        Returns:
        an instance of a concrete derived class for ConnectedComponent
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - in case the number of connected components exceeds the Short.MAX_VALUE (32767) or if the image doesn't have type GRAY8.
        See Also:
        ImageConnectedComponents.getLabeledComponents(wrapScienceJ.wrapImaJ.connectivity.LabelingPolicy, int, boolean, double, wrapScienceJ.wrapImaJ.connectivity.filtering.ComponentRemovalPredicate, boolean, boolean)
